PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Preocupaчѕes ambientais tem sido colocada no topo da lista de muitas pesquisas cientэficas e conferъncias, especialmente apѓs os anos 80, quando a detecчуo da forte perda na camada de ozєnio causou um grande susto. Em teor parecido, preocupaчѕes socioeconєmicas tem crescido e ganhado a atenчуo de pesquisadores e demais interessados, principalmente apѓs o surgimento do conceito de sustentabilidade que, por sua vez, surgiu em 1980 durante uma Assemblщia Geral das Naчѕes Unidas, em Brundtland, Noruega.O grande desenvolvimento das infraestruturas de telecomunicaчѕes em diversos paэses no mundo permitiu que Internet encontrasse um ambiente adequado ao seu desenvolvimento. Esse fato se concretizou um pouco adiante, no inэcio dos anos 2000. Consequentemente, a Web comeчou a se desenvolver de forma surpreendente atщ entуo. No que tange as metodologias e tщcnicas computacionais, a Web tem ganhado um grande espaчo para o desenvolvimento de sistemas computacionais, inclusive sistemas inteligentes.Tendo em vista o cenсrio e as atividades expostos acima, esse projeto foi proposto com o intuito de investigar a aplicaчуo e/ou aprimoramento de metodologias e tщcnicas computacionais, especialmente direcionadas para a construчуo de sistemas inteligentes, neste conjunto de atividades.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SEBBA PATTO, V.;SEBBA PATTO, VINI'CIUS;PATTO, VINICIUS SEBBA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract In this paper, we discuss the experience in the design, use and evaluation of a serious game about participatory management of national parks for biodiversity conservation and social inclusion. Our objective is to help various stakeholders (e.g., environmentalist NGOs, communities, tourism operators, public agencies, and so on) to collectively understand conflict dynamics for natural resources management and to exercise negotiation management strategies for protected areas, one of the key issues linked to biodiversity conservation in national parks. Our serious game prototype combines, techniques such as: distributed role-playing games, support for negotiation between players, and insertion of various types of artificial agents (decision making agents, virtual players, assistant agents). After a general introduction to the project, we will present project?s current prototype architecture and results from game sessions, as well as some prospects for the future, namely: the design of assistant artificial agents and of virtual players and the integration of a viability-based simulation engine. Keywords: Serious games, Simulation, Participatory management of Parks

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: The use of assistant agents for the analysis and decision making in participatory management

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SEBBA PATTO, V.;SEBBA PATTO, VINI'CIUS;PATTO, VINICIUS SEBBA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The use of the coupled approach Multi-Agent Systems and Role-Playing Games (MAS/RPG) and its evolutions, such as the Participatory Simulation and Games and Multi-Agent-Based Simulations, has been aplied in many scenarios to study and investigate diverses hypotheses concerning, in most cases, the uses and simulations of natural resources and social interactions.

This thesis was carried out as part of the SimParc project, which focuses on the management of natural parks. The main goal of this project is to conceive an epistemic computer-based tool in order to promote training, education, and research for park?s managers, park councils? members, and other interested. This thesis concerns the author?s work and contribution to some scientific and technical problems illustrated by this project.

More precisely, this monography presents some prototypes developed in this project and the computational agents used in experiments. The author also highlights the importance of computational assistant agents in such experiments and the use of a non-intrusive assistance during the game?s negotiation step.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO-INGLES: Fuzzy Expert System to Water Quality Assessment in Meia Ponte River Watershed

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SEBBA PATTO, V.;SEBBA PATTO, VINI'CIUS;PATTO, VINICIUS SEBBA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Resumo:
Este trabalho é referente a uma pesquisa para avaliaчуo da qualidade de сgua mediante conceitos linguisticos. São propostos trъs эndices de qualidade de сgua, que são obtidos de acordo com o uso desta: ingestão sem tratamento, preservaчуo da biota aquática e tratamento de сgua. O sistema utiliza lógica nebulosa para fazer a inferъncia sobre os parтmetros analisados e obter os эndices. Os processos de racionabilidade verificados neste estudo foram implementados peela combinaчуo de trъs mщtodos de composiчуo (máximo dos mэınimos, máximo dos máximos e soma limitada) com quatro mщtodos de defuzzificaчуo (mщdia ponderada, mщdia dos máximos, primeiro dos máximos e ultimo dos máximos).
Pela análise dos resultados, constata-se que atravщs da utilizaчуo dos эndices obtidos pelo sistema, consegue-se avaliar mais adequadamente a qualidade de сgua do que atravщs de modelos matemáticos obtidos pela variaчуo daquele adotado pela CETESB, a partir de 1975, para a obtenчуo do эndice de qualidade de сgua.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract:
This work refers to a water quality assessment research by means of linguistic concepts. Three water quality indices were proposed, and they are obtained accordingly to the usage of that: ingestion without treatment, aquatic biota preservation and water treatment. The expert system uses fuzzy logic in order to make inference on biochemical and physical parameters and then, output the indices. The system cognitive processes verified on this research were implemented combining three composition methods (max-min, max-max and limited sum) with four defuzzification methods (weighted mean, mean of maximum, first of maximum and last of maximum). According to the results analysis, it is clear that the proposed indices can better assess water than mathematical models such as CETESB-inspired methods (proposed after the 1975s) to obtain water quality indices.
